content.text: Lack of winter rains(a) have delayed the sowing of(b) wheat crop in this area(c).No error(d)
The teacher let the boy off (a) with a warning(b) though he was convinced with his guilt.(c) No error.(d)
Our first trip was the most interesting one, but(a) our second one(b) was even more interesting.(c) No error.(d)
He has been going to the office(a) for a year now,(b) and he even can’t understand its working.(c) No error(d)
He boasts of having visited Europe many times(a) but he can neither speak English(b) nor he canspeak French.(c) No error.(d)
Whenever possible, one should avail the opportunity(a) that come one’s way(b) if one wants to achieve success in life.(c) No error.(d)
When my friends came to visit us (a) at the railway station(b) they left some of their luggages.(c) No error.(d)
As an officer(a) he not only was competent(b) but also honest.(c) No error.(d)
If you will come tomorrow(a) we can go to the market(b) and do our own shopping together.(c) No error(d)
If we exercise regularly(a) we will be(b) more healthier.(c) No error.(d)
News travel(a) very fast today(c) due to advancement in technology.(c) No error.(d)
The Chairman made it clear at(a) the meeting that he will not step down(b) from his position as chairman.(c) No error.(d)
We had(a) lot of difficulty(b) in finding the way here.(c) No error.(d)
Just as he was driving along the road,(a) a bus pulled up and the driver asked him(b) if he has seen abriefcase on the road.(c) No error(d)
Experience has taught me(a) not to ignore any man, high or low,(b) not to ignore anything, great or small.(c) No error(d)
I have spent(a) most of my money,(b) so I can travel only by bus(c) No error.(d)
When he asked me as to why(a) I had not finished my work in time(b) I felt confused.(c) No error.(d)
The Foreign Minister said(a) there was no use to criticise the policy of non-alignment(b) which had stood the test of time.(c) No error.(d)
The train should arrive(a) at 7:30 in the morning(b) but it was almost an hour late.(c) No error.(d)
The young man was well dressed because

options.text: it was his habit to dress well.
he wanted to meet the manager of the shop.
he wanted to impress the salesman.

content.text: The salesmen in the shop are described as people who pay attention to
The young man moved away to the hosiery section because he

options.text: was not interested in purchasing anything now.
did not like the readymade clothes.

content.text: The manager asked the young man what he wanted because

options.text: he would give him exactly what he was looking for.
the salesman had drawn his attention to the indifferent attitude of the young man.
he thought they could do more business with him that way.
he thought the visitor was dissatisfied.

content.text: The young man left without making purchases because he

options.text: could not find any item of his choice.
had come only to make a point about the indifferent attitude of the salesmen towards casually dressed customers.
decided to come to make the purchases later on.

content.text: For what crime had the prisoner been punished?
When had the crime been committed?
Who slumped forward with a dull thud?
What did the prisoner suffer the most during imprisonment?
From the passage, which of the following statements most correctly reflects the opinion of the author?

options.text: Nationalism makes people self-centered and self-concerned
It helps a nation to become superior to other nations

content.text: Which of the following phrases most correctly suggests the central theme of the passage?

options.text: Nationalism as an inspiration for development
Nationalism as a cause of war
Evils of narrow and aggressive nationalism

content.text: From the passage which of the following statements can be assumed to be most likely to be true?

options.text: The author believes the nationalism is always a curse.
He believes that it is possible for men to misuse religion.
He thinks that religion always leads men astray.
He pleads for a mix-up of religion and nationalism

content.text: Consider the following statements:1. Brown and Cornelius sat round the fire.2. Cornelius lay half-asleep at a little distance from the fire.3. All the people sat round the fire.Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
One of them disappeared down the hill implies that

options.text: the slope of the hill was slippery.
he fell from the edge of the hill.
there was suddenly a sea beside the hill.

content.text: “He didn’t think. . .in the dark”. This sentence actually implies that he

options.text: was the only person who knew where in the boat tobacco was.

content.text: What does the word “huddling” imply?
The writer was against shooting the elephant because

options.text: he suspected it to be a wild one and was afraid of it.
his heart was full of compassion for animals.
he was certain that the elephant was innocent.
it would amount to avoidable waste of useful property.

content.text: The author compares the elephant to a costly machine because

options.text: it can do as much work as an expensive machine.
elephants and machines have similar prices.

content.text: The elephant looked no more dangerous than a cow because

options.text: it was quietly doing its work.
unlike lions, it is a vegetarian animal.
its tusks resemble the cow’s horns.
cows can be very dangerous sometimes.

content.text: The author was very fond of the old soldier because

options.text: He had lost one of his legs in war.
he used to tell the author about his adventures.
he was contented with his lot.
he had been to many countries.

content.text: Why did the old soldier repeatedly tell that he walked two hundred miles?

options.text: He ran away from home to join the army.
He had to cross the Libyan desert.
He had to escape from a prison-of-war camp.

content.text: The story of the old soldier that the author liked most was that about

options.text: his running away from home to join the army.
his first battle in the Libyan desert.
the loss of his leg in Assam.
his escape from a Japanese prison-of-war camp

content.text: The old soldier, according to the author, was
The soldier’s leg had to be amputated because

options.text: he had walked two hundred miles in two weeks.
he was shot in the leg while escaping from the Japanese camp.

content.text: What was the actual reason for the organisers to have a difficult time?

options.text: A large number of people had come to the meeting.
The organisers could not make proper arrangements.
The meeting could not be started in time.

content.text: What does the world “assuaging” imply?
Further delay resulted in the people

S1. Her sisters recognized her at once.S6. As for the young prince, he found her more lovely and lovable than ever, and insisted upon marrying her immediately.P. She embraced them, telling them she forgave them with all her heartQ. Then she departed with the herald to the King’s palaceR. They were not in the least surprised, for everybody believed in fairies, and everybody longed to have a fairy godmotherS. She told her whole story to His Majesty and the royal familyThe proper sequence should be

S1. No daily paper has ever found its way into this village.S6. They carry this with them to the trading centres in the plains and cities.P. These travellers come from distant places.Q. On their return journey they have news from this hills.R. The only news the inhabitants get is from travellers.S. On their way into the hills they being news from distant plains and cities of India.The proper sequence should be

S1. As stag was drinking water at a pool.S6. He was thus caught by the hunters.P. He was admiring his shadow in the waterQ. All of a sudden some hunters came to the poolR. From what he saw, he liked his horns, but he was rather unhappy about his legsS. His legs helped him in getting away from the hunters, but his horns were caught in a bushThe proper sequence should be

S1. The wise men laughed at Galileo for presuming to differ from the great AristotleS6. Both struck the ground together, as he had asserted that they wouldP. He then climbed to the top, carrying with him a ten pound shot and a one-pound shotQ. So one morning he took some students and teachers to the base of the famous Learning TowerR. Balancing them on the edge of the tower, he let them fall togetherS. But Galileo said he could prove his statement The proper sequence should be

S1. The earth was initially very hot and without an atmosphereS6. But it contained a lot of other gases that are poisonous to usP. The atmosphere came from the emission of gases from the rocksQ. Because it contained no oxygenR. In the course of time it cooled and acquired an atmosphereS. This early atmosphere was not one in which we could have survivedThe proper sequence should be

S1. When Madhu opened the living room, an extraordinary sight met her eyesS6. Hurrying upstairs, she went to her dressing table but to her relief found that the man had taken only an imitation diamond necklaceP. She soon returned home in a police car with two policemenQ. A strange man was fast asleep in an armchairR. Madhu left the house immediately and went to the police stationS. But it was now too late, the man had disappearedThe proper sequence should be

S1. When Galileo was young, people believed that the earth was the centre of the UniverseS6. But time has proved that Galileo’s view was rightP. But Galileo began to argue that it was not soQ. This belief was supported by the State and the ChurchR. He said that the Earth and other planets moved round the sunS. He was imprisoned for voicing this unorthodox viewThe proper sequence should be

S1. Until the hospital could be built there was no surgery available for the patientsS6. After a short time an emergency hospital was created from a rough fowl-houseP. But there were disadvantagesQ. Schweitzer therefore started his medical treatment in an open space outside his houseR. Moreover, there was a storm almost every evening, when everything had to be dragged hurriedly to the shelter of the verandaS. Working in the sun was very tiring.The proper sequence should be

S1. In 1739, Nadir Shah, the mighty king of Iran, invaded India S6. Another trophy he took with him was the Peacock Throne built by ShahjahanP. After a stay of two months, Nadir Shah went back to IranQ. He defeated the Mughal army in the battle at KarnalR. He took with him immense wealth as well as the Koh-i-noor diamondS. This was followed by the cruel massacre and reckless plunder of DelhiThe proper sequence should be

S1. It was a very pleasant walk along the banks of the river.S6. It charmed me beyond measure.P. The buffalo had huge horns.Q. A kind of unknown calm and peace seemed to slide into my soul.R. What delighted me most was the sight of a little boy sitting on the last buffalo in the herd.S. I saw a herd of buffaloes swimming across the river.The proper sequence should be

S1. A reporter is someone who gathers and writes news.S6. The reporter and the editor are both called newsmen.P. An editor is someone who prepares all the news for printing in the newspaper.Q. A reporter cannot do a good job unless he has a good understanding of the requirements of the editor of his newspaper.R. The editor decides how important each news story is and where it should be placed.S. Many editors are former reporters.The proper sequence should be

S1. Of men’s earliest inventions we know very little.S6. Once man had fire, he was the master of all lower creatures.P. Man used stick and stone long before he dared to meddle with fire.Q. The first was to use a stone to crack a nut. R. The next was the use of a stick to strike an enemy.S. It was only a step further that he made a rude weapon by fastening a stone to the end of a stick.The proper sequence should be

S1. The detective walked into the dark room alone.S6. He carefully picked up the gun making sure not to smudge the fingerprints.P. It was later that the found the gun lying under a chair.Q. First he felt for the switch and turned on the light. R. The furniture was smashed and the curtains tom.S. at once he saw the disorder and confusion in the room. The proper sequence should be

S1. Last night I was very tired and dropped off to sleep.S6. A goat was chewing up my rose plants.P. I thought I heard somebody move outside.Q. All of a sudden, a slight noise disturbed my sleep.R. I got out of bed quietly and peeped out of the window.S. I was frightened.The proper sequence should be

S1. The parents of Bose wanted him to become an I.C.S. Officer. S6. His resignation showed that his country’s freedom was more important to him than his personal ambitions.P. But his heart was not for government service.Q. He studied zealously and got through the I.C.S. examination in the fourth rank.R. Soon he resigned from the I.C.S. to the bewilderment of all.S. Very much against his will, he was sent to England. The proper sequence should be

S1. The train was running fast and the next station was nearly an hour ahead.S6. She bought four cups of ice cream and all of them became busy with eating.P. The children were pestering their aunt with embarrassing questions.Q. The occupants of the first carriage among others were a tall girl, a little girl and a little boy.R. Luckily an ice cream vendor came to the rescue of the aunt.S. Their aunt was occupying a corner seat.The proper sequence should be

S1. One winter afternoon she had been buying something in a little antique shop in Curzon Street.S6. He clasped his hands: he was so gratified he could scarcely speak.P. Therefore she visited this shop once again.Q. It was a shop she always liked to visit.R. He beamed whenever she came in.S. And the man who kept it was very fond of serving her. The proper sequence should be

S1. My friend Todd owes me a dollar.S6. I see that I shall never get it back.P. Whenever I meet him, he does not show any indication that he owes me a dollar.Q. My dollar has gone out of his mind.R. Thus he meets me in the same frank friendly was as always.S. He has owed it to me for twelve months, and I fear there is little prospect of his ever returning it. The proper sequence should be
